qas.question: Is poultry available in various forms?

answers.text: fresh or frozen, as whole birds or as joints (cuts), bone-in or deboned, seasoned in various ways, raw or ready cooked.

qas.question: What is the most substantial part of a birds antomy as it apples to consupmtion og the meat?

answers.text: The meatiest parts of a bird are the flight muscles on its chest, called "breast" meat, and the walking muscles on the legs, called the "thigh" and "drumstick"

qas.question: Are certain parts of the bird used for particular reasons in relation to receipes?

answers.text: wings are also eaten (Buffalo wings are a popular example in the United States) and may be split into three segments,

qas.question: What liquid form is poultry normally kept in?
What kind of food can never be deboned?

plausible_answers.text: the flight muscles on its chest, called "breast" meat

qas.question: What part of the bird is considered poison?
What kind of wings are no longer eaten in the US?

context: <b4_0>Poultry<b4_0/> is available <a0_0><b3_0>fresh or frozen<b3_0/>, as whole birds or as joints (cuts), bone-in or deboned, seasoned in various ways, raw or ready cooked.<a0_0/> <a1_0>The meatiest parts of a bird are <b5_0>the flight muscles on its chest, called "breast" meat<b5_0/>, and the walking muscles on the legs, called the "thigh" and "drumstick"<a1_0/>. The <a2_0>wings are also eaten (<b6_0>Buffalo wings<b6_0/> are a popular example in the United States) and may be split into three segments,<a2_0/> the meatier "drumette", the "wingette" (also called the "flat"), and the wing tip (also called the "flapper"). In Japan, the wing is frequently separated, and these parts are referred to as 手羽元 (teba-moto "wing base") and 手羽先 (teba-saki "wing tip").
